summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from August 6, 2019, discussing the planning and logistics for a search warrant execution on Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas. The email indicates the warrant affidavit is being drafted by the SDNY, with plans for FBI agents to travel and conduct the search the following weekend.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: Appears as the author of the initial email planning the logistics for the search of Epstein's island, and is identified as SSA for Squad C-20 (Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking) at the FBI New York office.

events.title: Search Warrant Sworn Out
events.description: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) is drafting a search warrant affidavit for Epstein's island, with the expectation the warrant will be sworn out on Friday in St. Thomas.

events.title: Planned FBI Travel to Epstein's Island
events.description: FBI personnel plan to fly out on the FBI Q400 plane to St. Thomas to execute the search warrant on Epstein's private island.

events.title: Planned Search of Epstein's Island
events.description: The search of Epstein's island, to be managed by the FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT), is expected to take 1-3 days.

events.title: Planned FBI Travel Home
events.description: Thursday is tentatively planned as the travel day home for the FBI team after the search.

keyFacts: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) was actively drafting a search warrant affidavit for Jeffrey Epstein's private island in August 2019.
The FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad (C-20) from New York was planning to travel to execute the warrant.
The search was planned to be a multi-day operation managed by the FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT).
The email demonstrates active, high-level planning for a significant investigative action against Epstein's assets shortly after his arrest.
